author: Kiran Khatri
content: A Swedish startup has created a microchip that can be implanted into the skin and can display one's COVID-19 vaccine certificate when scanned using a smartphone. "This means it's always accessible for me or for anyone else, really, who wants to read me," DSruptive Subdermals' MD Hannes Sjoblad said. An advanced version of a chip implant costs $112, he added.
title: Microchip that stores COVID-19 vaccine pass under users' skin made by Swedish firm, waiting to relase

author: Kiran Khatri
content: After a report said Elon Musk's page was the third-most popular on Wikipedia in 2021, the world's richest person tweeted, "My Wiki is such a dumpster fire. That's how you know it isn't curated." "History is written by...victors, except on Wikipedia, as your enemies are still alive and have lots of time on their hands," the Tesla CEO added.
title: My Wiki's a dumpster fire: Musk as report says his page was 3rd most-popular in 2021

author: Arshiya Chopra
content: Elon Musk mocked the idea of metaverse and said, "I don't know if I necessarily buy into this Metaverse stuff...I don't see someone strapping a friggin' screen to their face all day." Musk stated that he doesn't believe that people would abandon the physical world and replace it with a virtual one, especially with a screen on their faces.
title: Musk mocks 'metaverse', says 'nobody wants to strap a friggin' screen to face all day'

author: Kiran Khatri
content: Amid a discussion on Web3 on Twitter, meme-based cryptocurrency Dogecoin's creator Billy Markus wrote, "Bitcoin just gives power to new rich people." Responding to this, world's richest person Elon Musk said, "That's why I'm pro Doge." Block CEO and former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey wrote, "No one rich individual or institution has any more power over Bitcoin than anyone else."
title: That's why I'm pro Doge: Musk as Dogecoin creator says Bitcoin 'gives power to rich'

author: Hiral Goyal
content: A Russian court on Friday imposed a fine of 7.2 billion rubles ($98 million) on Alphabet's Google for repeatedly failing to delete content deemed illegal by the country. The court said that the penalty was calculated based on Google's revenue. Russia has fined several technology giants this year, however, until the latest ruling, the fines were usually under $1 million.
title: Google is fined $98 million by Russia for failing to delete banned content on it's territory

author: Arshiya Chopra
content: Ola Co-founder Bhavish Aggarwal responded to a journalist who shared an article claiming that Ola is facing hurdles in e-scooter production and tweeted, "Is [Bhavish] going to do an [Elon Musk] and sleep in #OLA factory...Maybe he should." He replied, "Been there done that...Factory ramping up fast to full scale...Such biased articles with factual inaccuracies...underestimate what India can do."
title: Been there done that: Ola Co-founder on tweet saying 'sleep in factory like Musk did'

author: Kiran Khatri
content: An Indian tea company has said it gifted a personalised NFT to newly-appointed Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal to capture his "landmark moment". Vahdam India's CEO Bala Sarda said, "This is a proud moment for all of us here in India...The realisation of Twitter being led by an Indian is simply surreal." The NFT shows Agrawal sipping tea in his office.
title: Tea company creates NFT for Parag Agrawal, says an Indian leading Twitter is 'surreal'

author: Kiran Khatri
content: A TikTok content moderator in US has sued TikTok, saying she suffers from "post-traumatic stress disorder" (PTSD) and has "horrific nightmares" due to disturbing videos she's had to watch. The videos included cannibalism, crushed heads and suicides, the suit said. It also claimed Tiktok failed to offer psychological support or limit shift hours to help moderators cope with such images.
title: Tiktok content moderator sues firm, says got PTSD after watching suicides, cannibalism

author: Hiral Goyal
content: World's first dual-mode vehicle (DMV) that can run on both roads and railway tracks is set to make debut in Japan's Kaiyo on Saturday. The vehicle runs on rubber tyres on road and steel wheels descend from its underbelly when it arrives at an interchange. It runs at a speed of 60km/h on rail tracks and around 100km/h on roads.
title: World's 1st DMV that can run on roads & rail tracks to make debut in Japan on 27th December

author: Kiran Khatri
content: Pranay Pathole, a 23-year-old Pune-based engineer, wrote on Twitter, "On Christmas Eve 2008, Tesla funding round completed, Tesla was literally a few days from bankruptcy." "Elon Musk had to put in all his money and assets," he added. Musk responded saying, "That was a crazy tough year. Tesla financing closed at 6pm Christmas Eve – last hour of...last day possible."
title: Indian engineer tweets Tesla neared bankruptcy on Christmas Eve 2008; Musk responds

author: Aishwarya Awasthi
content: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey while discussing his stand against blockchain-based internet concept 'Web3' said, "I'm not anti ETH. I'm anti-centralised, VC-owned, single point of failure, and corporate controlled lies." Earlier, Dorsey mocked VC firm Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), a Web3 backer, saying, "It's somewhere between a and z." "I care only about decentralised...foundations," Dorsey said.
title: I'm anti centralised, corporate controlled lies: Dorsey discussing 'Web3', one of the most desired tech

author: Aishwarya Awasthi
content: The Netherlands' top competition regulator has said Apple broke the country's competition laws and ordered it to allow dating-apps providers to use alternative payment systems. The company faces a fine of up to $56.6 million if it fails to comply. Apple has been given until January 15 to implement changes. "We disagree with the order issued by...ACM," Apple said.
title: Apple asked to let dating-apps offer alternate payment options in Netherlands
